body: Thanks for the link to the article Alex, it seems like a very plausible explanation for what I have observed. I'm guessing that the installer did its job, and that the environment variables were altered, but that running the command prompt after the install did not pick those changes up yet. I probably (incorrectly) assumed that the env vars were not changed because of that. It would explain why I now have the directory in both the system PATH as my personal PATH.
